articles.title: HTML & CSS
articles.description: Explore the building blocks of web design with our deep dive into HTML & CSS. Learn how these technologies work together to create the internet's visual and structural aspects.
articles.author: Dobri Dobrev

sections.heading: Introduction to HTML
sections.content: HTML is the skeleton of all web pages. It provides the basic structure, which is then enhanced and styled by CSS and JavaScript.

sections.heading: Basics of CSS
sections.content: CSS is used to control the presentation, formatting, and layout of web pages, allowing developers to create visually engaging pages.

sections.heading: Integrating HTML with CSS
sections.content: Combining HTML and CSS allows developers to structure content and define its appearance with styling options.

sections.heading: Responsive Design
sections.content: Responsive web design ensures that websites look good on all devices, using a mix of flexible grids and layouts, images, and an intelligent use of CSS media queries.

sections.heading: Advanced Selectors
sections.content: CSS offers a range of advanced selectors that allow developers to target elements in specific ways, enhancing the dynamism and interactivity of web pages.

sections.heading: Animation with CSS
sections.content: CSS3 introduces animations, allowing for the creation of complex animations and transitions that enhance user interactions without relying on external libraries.

articles.title: PHP
articles.description: PHP: The server-side scripting language essential for dynamic web content. Discover its power in web development, from managing databases to processing forms.
articles.author: John Wick

sections.heading: Getting Started with PHP
sections.content: PHP is pivotal for dynamic content on the web, allowing for server-side scripting, database interactions, and more.

sections.heading: Variables and Data Types
sections.content: Understanding variables and data types is fundamental in PHP, enabling developers to manipulate data effectively.

sections.heading: Control Structures
sections.content: PHP supports a wide range of control structures, such as if statements, loops, and switch cases, facilitating complex decision-making processes.

sections.heading: Functions in PHP
sections.content: Functions are reusable blocks of code that perform a specific task, making code more modular, readable, and maintainable.

sections.heading: Working with Databases
sections.content: PHP can interact with databases, most notably MySQL, allowing for the creation, reading, updating, and deletion of database records.

sections.heading: PHP and Web Security
sections.content: Security is paramount in web development, and PHP provides numerous features and best practices to safeguard web applications against vulnerabilities.

articles.title: Laravel
articles.description: Laravel simplifies complex web development tasks with elegant syntax and powerful tools. It's the go-to PHP framework for developers seeking efficiency and sophistication.
articles.author: Jessica Simpson

sections.heading: Why Laravel?
sections.content: Laravel simplifies and speeds up the web development process with elegant syntax, powerful tools, and robust features.

sections.heading: Routing in Laravel
sections.content: Laravel routing allows developers to direct application traffic, defining routes in an intuitive and flexible way.

sections.heading: MVC Architecture
sections.content: Laravel is built on the MVC architecture, separating the logic of the application from the UI, promoting clean coding practices.

sections.heading: Eloquent ORM
sections.content: Eloquent provides a beautiful, simple ActiveRecord implementation for working with your database and allows for defining relationships in an intuitive way.

sections.heading: Authentication and Authorization
sections.content: Laravel makes implementing authentication and authorization straightforward, providing out-of-the-box configurations for many common scenarios.

sections.heading: Task Scheduling and Management
sections.content: Task scheduling in Laravel allows developers to fluently and expressively define command schedule within the application itself.

articles.title: Angular
articles.description: Angular: Revolutionizing the way we develop web applications. This comprehensive guide explores its robust features for creating dynamic, single-page applications.
articles.author: Antonio Banderas

sections.heading: Introduction to Angular
sections.content: Angular is a platform that makes it easy to build applications with the web. It combines declarative templates, dependency injection, end-to-end tooling, and integrated best practices to solve development challenges.

sections.heading: Components and Modules
sections.content: Components are the building blocks of Angular applications, and modules help organize an application into cohesive blocks of functionality.

sections.heading: Data Binding
sections.content: Angular provides powerful data binding features, allowing for synchronization between the model and the view.

sections.heading: Services and Dependency Injection
sections.content: Services are a great way to share information among classes that don't know each other. Dependency Injection (DI) is a way to supply a new instance of a class with the fully-formed dependencies it requires.

sections.heading: Routing
sections.content: The Angular Router enables navigation from one view to the next as users perform application tasks.

sections.heading: Testing
sections.content: Angular is built with testing in mind, and it provides a robust framework for ensuring your applications work as intended.

articles.title: TypeScript
articles.description: TypeScript brings static typing to JavaScript, enhancing code quality and maintainability. Learn how it empowers developers to write more robust and error-free code.
articles.author: Don Pippo

sections.heading: Why TypeScript?
sections.content: TypeScript adds optional types to JavaScript that support tools for large-scale JavaScript applications for any browser, for any host, on any OS.

sections.heading: Basic Types
sections.content: Understand the basic types in TypeScript, like boolean, number, string, array, tuple, enum, any, void, null and undefined, and never.

sections.heading: Interfaces
sections.content: TypeScript’s core principle is that type checking focuses on the shape that values have. An interface is a way to define a contract on a function with respect to the arguments and their types.

sections.heading: Classes and Inheritance
sections.content: TypeScript supports modern JavaScript object-oriented programming features including classes and interfaces, offering a way to structure code in a more reusable and interconnected way.

sections.heading: Generics
sections.content: Generics provide a way to make components work with any data type and not restrict to one data type. So, components can be called or used with a variety of data types.

sections.heading: Advanced Types and Techniques
sections.content: Exploring advanced types like union types, intersection types, type guards, and type assertions in TypeScript enhances the flexibility and robustness of your code.

articles.title: Javascript
articles.description: Delve into JavaScript's core concepts, from basics to advanced topics. This article covers everything: variables, functions, control structures, event handling, async patterns.
articles.author: Bob Marley

sections.heading: Variables and Data Types
sections.content: Explanation of var, let, and const. Overview of data types: String, Number, Boolean, Object, Array, null, and undefined.

sections.heading: Functions
sections.content: Introduction to function syntax, arrow functions, and function expressions. Reflection on JavaScript's growth and its future in web development.

sections.heading: Control Structures
sections.content: Explanation of if-else, switch, loops (for, while), and error handling (try-catch). Discussion on scope and closures.

sections.heading: Event Handling
sections.content: Overview of adding event listeners to DOM elements and responding to user actions.

sections.heading: Asynchronous JavaScript
sections.content: Explanation of callbacks, promises, async/await, and handling asynchronous operations.

sections.heading: Modern JavaScript Features
sections.content: ES6 and beyond: Template literals, destructuring, spread/rest operator, and new data structures (Map, Set).
